description: A seminar series featuring cutting-edge neuroscience research from early-career scientists

talks.speaker: Clifford Harpole
talks.title: Vocal repertoire expansion in singing mice by co-opting a conserved midbrain circuit node

talks.speaker: Eric Garr
talks.title: Learning cause and effect with the help of mesostriatal dopamine

talks.speaker: Marie Doyle
talks.title: Alcohol abstinence precipitates increased alcohol seeking and compulsive intake in association with phenotypic BNST dynamics

talks.speaker: Tim Currier
talks.title: Infrequent strong connections constrain connectomic predictions of neuronal function

talks.speaker: Drew Schreiner
talks.title: A synaptic locus of song learning

talks.speaker: James Siho Lee
talks.title: An unusual, protective behavior in the arsenic-resistant nematode Tokorhabditis tufae

talks.speaker: Miral Abdalaziz
talks.title: Visuospatial working memory depends on the phase-locking of beta oscillations in macaque parietal cortex

talks.speaker: Hannah Wirtshafter
talks.title: A universal hippocampal memory code across animals and environments

talks.speaker: Pei-Yin Shih
talks.title: Genetic and Neurobiological Mechanisms of Aggression in Siamese fighting fish
